title: Paris 2024: What we know about the opening ceremony on the Seine
summary: The first-ever opening ceremony to take place outdoors will kick off at 7:30 pm on Friday. Nearly a hundred boats will slowly sail down the river as artists will perform on its banks and above the water. The exact details are kept secret.

title: Paris 2024: closed subway stations, inaccessible bridges... What to expect on opening ceremony day
summary: Throughout the entire day of Friday, July 26, many subway stations will be inaccessible, while the last bridges open in the city will gradually close.

title: 2024 Olympic Games opening ceremony: No Zelensky in Paris?
summary: A list of attendees for a reception hosted by President Emmanuel Macron at the Élysée Palace tomorrow (which was released on Thursday, July 25), does not include the name of the Ukrainian President. With the opening of the world's largest sporting event just one day away, Zelensky's absence would be highly conspicuous.

title: 2024 Olympics: How greater Paris' transport network got ready for the crowds
summary: Getting spectators to Olympic sites by public transport, bicycle or on foot, ensuring disabled access solutions and security were all major challenges for the French capital.

title: Paris 2024: An Olympic capital in a tense and divided world
summary: The Olympic Games, with its opening ceremony scheduled for Friday, July 26, will unfold against a geopolitical backdrop marked by conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza, rendering the idea of an 'Olympic truce' ineffective.

title: Paris 2024: Fiji stun France in Olympic rugby sevens showdown
summary: Fiji, despite trailing early in the match, dominated the game and made a strong comeback to secure a victory that propelled them into the quarterfinals.

title: 'It is time to get this deal done:' Harris toughens Democratic stance on Israel-Palestine conflict
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met separately with President Joe Biden and vice president Kamala Harris on Thursday, July 25. Harris, who has been more vocal on Gaza than Biden, has sparked speculation that she might advocate for a firmer attitude towards Israel.

title: Artificial intelligence: Trump and Vance want less regulation, more power, to counter China
summary: When it comes to AI, the Republican presidential candidate and his vice presidential nominee appear determined to diverge from the Biden administration's regulatory approach.

title: London, Seoul, and Washington warn of North Korea cyber op to steal military, nuclear secrets
summary: The American cybersecurity and infrastructure security agency (CISA) warns that this ongoing threat remains a global concern, impacting various industrial sectors and affecting countries including India and Japan.

title: Babe Ruth jersey sets world record for sports memorabilia at auction
summary: The item was among a trove of possessions put up for auction by Ruth's family, including family photos, hunting gloves, and a suitcase Ruth traveled with on a trip to Japan in 1934.

title: Fast-spreading wildfire ravages northern California, forcing thousands to evacuate
summary: The Park Fire broke out Wednesday evening, on the last day of a heat wave affecting the region.

title: Paris 2024: Law enforcement officers face 'Games Pass' headache
summary: In the days since the security perimeter for the opening ceremony was set up, law enforcement officers have had to deal with randomly functioning QR codes, ill-tempered Parisians and lost tourists.

title: US Congress divided over Netanyahu's Washington speech
summary: The Israeli prime minister was cheered by Republicans during his remarks on Wednesday whereas many Democrats boycotted his address.

title: Italy, Niger's last Western partner
summary: The junta that seized power in Niamey a year ago has entered into partnerships with Russia, Turkey and Iran. Rome, whose diplomatic efforts are focused on controlling migratory flows, remains an ally of the Niger putschists.

title: Hervé Renard, coach of the French women's football team: 'I was promised hell'
summary: The French women's national football team faces Colombia on Thursday in the opening match of the Olympic tournament. Their coach hopes to 'draw inspiration' from the success of other French team sports at the 2021 Tokyo Olympics.

title: UK's Keir Starmer carries on purge of Labour Party's left wing
summary: Exerting authority soon after his recent appointment, the prime minister temporarily suspended seven lawmakers from his party who had advocated to scrap the cap on family benefits.

title: The secret life of Agent Griaznov, the Russian spy suspected of trying to 'destabilize' the Paris Olympics
summary: Thanks to numerous documents and exclusive sources, Le Monde was able to retrace the career of Kirill Gryaznov, ex-reality TV star turned FSB spy, who boasted of offering the French an opening ceremony 'like no other.'

title: Russia's relentless air strikes are forcing Ukraine to revolutionize electricity production
summary: Due to their high vulnerability to Russian missiles, the large Soviet-era thermal and hydroelectric power plants will need to make way for a decentralized, fragmented and more expensive power production infrastructure.

title: Paris 2024: A festive first day in rugby sevens, yet short of blue sparkles
summary: Even before the Olympic ceremony, Antoine Dupont's French sevens kickstarted the Games on Wednesday, with a draw and a victory, in front of a record crowd.

title: 2024 Olympics: Practical questions about getting around Paris, on foot, by public transit, bike or car
summary: The Paris police prefecture has set out perimeters of movement restrictions around the sites of the Olympic competitions and the opening ceremony. Public transport networks will also be disrupted.

title: Where are the fan zones in and around Paris, to follow the 2024 Olympics for free?
summary: Dozens of Clubs 2024 sites will be open to the general public free of charge in the Paris region during the Olympic Games.

title: War in Ukraine: Russian forces advance in the Donetsk region
summary: As the Russian army ramps up its offensive ahead of the rainy season, several Ukrainian units are at risk of encirclement.

title: Two high-ranking members of Mexico's Sinaloa arrested in Texas
summary: The cartel, which was born in the northwestern state of Sinaloa, is one of Mexico's most powerful and violent criminal groups.

title: Yemen: Western armies powerless to halt Houthi attacks
summary: The deployment of American and European ships in the Red Sea, as well as airstrikes by the United States and the United Kingdom on Yemen, have failed to deter the rebel militia, which controls most of the country, from continuing its operations.

title: Paris 2024: Reigning World Cup champions Spain win women's Olympic football opener
summary: The Spanish team made its Olympic women's football debut on Thursday, July 25, at the Paris Games as leading contenders to win the gold medal after their World Cup triumph in Australia and New Zealand last year.

title: Kamala-mania brings enthusiasm back to Democratic camp
summary: The US vice president's digital campaign is flooding social media with images and symbols representing the likely Democratic candidate for the White House, fueling a grassroots craze, particularly among young people.

title: Understanding the controversy around Sniffy: The energizing white powder with a cocaine-like appearance banned by the State
summary: After weeks of controversy, the French government has decided to ban this energizing product, heavily criticized by addiction experts.

title: Paris 2024: The opening ceremony's many challenges
summary: The first of its kind organized on a body of water, the parade of Olympic delegations down Paris' Seine river on Friday requires extraordinary security measures.

title: Paris 2024: Olympic officials seek explanations after Argentina-Morocco chaos
summary: The opening match of the men’s football tournament was suspended for nearly two hours during added time after Morocco fans invaded the field and threw bottles in protest of a late goal by Argentina. A goal that was later overturned by the video assistant referee.

title: 'When people gawk at my hair, I'm glad not to flinch:' Young women reject the 'diktat' of body hair removal
summary: Inspired by the body positivity movement on social media, an increasing number of women under 25 are rejecting the smooth-shaven trend to reclaim control over their bodies.

title: How the French left prepares Lucie Castets, its surprise candidate for prime minister, to govern
summary: The Paris City Hall's finance director has called on the president to 'take responsibility' by appointing her without delay. She also dismissed 'a coalition with the presidential camp' due to 'deep disagreements.'

title: France's high-speed trains struck by 'malicious acts'
summary: The TGV high-speed rail network has been disrupted on lines to the country's west, north and east, with service being cut off on some sections, causing delays ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony.

title: Jill Biden, royals, no Russians: Top guests expected at the Paris Olympics opening ceremony
summary: Friday's grand opening on the River Seine will be attended by over a hundred heads of state and government. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has not confirmed his attendance, but Israeli President Isaac Herzog will attend the ceremony, under heavy protection.

title: Paris Olympics: 70-80% chance of 'moderate to heavy' rain during opening ceremony
summary: 'Rain, rain, go away, please come back another day': The Paris 2024 Olympics organizers may not get this wish for the lavish opening ceremony on the Seine, as very high chances of showers.

title: Macron banks on 'universalism of the Games' as he hosts foreign counterparts
summary: The French president will host around 100 national leaders at the Elysée, ahead of the Olympic opening ceremony. However, lacking an Olympic truce, he will not be in a position to pursue major diplomatic initiatives.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Harris makes her position known after meeting with Netanyahu
summary: The vice-president and now US presidential candidate said she would 'not remain silent' in the face of Palestinian suffering and had told the Israeli prime minister to get the ceasefire deal done.

title: Obama endorses Harris for president
summary: Former president Barack Obama and his wife Michelle threw their full support behind  Kamala Harris to be the Democrats' candidate in the November elections.

title: 'Now, it's the Olympics': Macron declares 'political truce' but French government still on alert
summary: France is officially kicking off the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. President Emmanuel Macron hopes that his idea of a 'political truce' will temporarily put aside the governmental crisis that has gripped the country over recent weeks.

title: Basel-Mulhouse airport at French-Swiss border re-opens after bomb alert
summary: The airport, located in France in the immediate vicinity of the Swiss border, re-opened after a short evacuation.

title: Sabotage on France's rail network before Paris Olympics: What we know
summary: High-speed train traffic was disrupted after three of the four main lines around Paris were affected by 'malicious acts' including arson. Traffic is expected to remain affected throughout the week-end.

title: Paris 2024: Map of the opening ceremony
summary: The Paris Olympics will kick off on Friday, July 26, with a grandiose opening ceremony on the River Seine.

title: Isabelle Backouche, historian: 'The Seine was the beating heart of Parisian life before the capital turned its back on it'
summary: The 18th century marked a turning point in Parisians' relationship with the river. In the face of royal powers who wanted to drive them out of the Seine, merchants and craftsmen resisted, but eventually had to withdraw. Out of this rupture was born a rationalized city that is now striving to rebuild its links with the river.

title: Paris 2024: Snoop Dogg carries the Olympic torch as it nears the end of its journey
summary: The US rapper smiled with delight as he carried the Olympic flame on Friday morning in the northern Paris suburb of Saint Denis.

title: Paris 2024 live: Follow the opening ceremony on the Seine
summary: The official competition started two days ago but the real festivities begin on Friday evening, with a parade that will take place outdoors, for the first time ever, on the river flowing through the French capital.

title: 'Raw meat': British team hit out at Olympic Village food
summary: The British team has been so distraught at the quality and quantity of food on offer at the Olympic Village that they have brought in their own chef.

title: Kremlin says Paris did not inform it of Russian suspect's arrest
summary: French authorities arrested Kirill Gryaznov over a suspected 'destabilization' plot targeting the Paris Olympics.

title: UK drops challenge to ICC's Netanyahu arrest warrant
summary: The UK government announced on Friday it was not submitting a challenge to the ICC chief prosecutor's decision to seek arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders, including Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Paris 2024: How to follow the Olympics with Le Monde in English
summary: Here's a look at the special coverage we have planned for the duration of the Games, and how you can best follow along.

title: Three wanted Bulgarians held over Paris Holocaust memorial defacement in May
summary: Bulgaria's State Agency for National Security said it had arrested three men under European arrest warrants following the defacement of the Wall of the Righteous in Paris with graffitis of red hands.

title: French rugby player Melvyn Jaminet suspended 34 weeks after racist video
summary: Jaminet also received a €30,000 fine. In a video, he had threatened to headbutt 'the first Arab I see.'

title: Thomas Jolly, the Peter Pan of theater turned head of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony
summary: The artistic director of the Paris 2024 opening and closing ceremonies, who went from Shakespeare's 'Henry VI' to the musical 'Starmania,' has always sought to make 'popular' art.

title: Paris 2024: Giannis Antetokounmpo, from stateless person to flag-bearer for Greece
summary: The basketball star, who was stateless until the age of 19, will lead the procession of nations holding the Greek flag in his hand, on Friday at the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games.

title: Paris Olympics live: Spectators and guests arrive at opening ceremony as rain looms
summary: The official competition started two days ago but the real festivities begin on Friday evening, with a parade that will take place outdoors, for the first time ever, on the river flowing through the French capital.

title: Where are the fan zones in and around Paris, to follow the 2024 Olympics for free?
summary: Dozens of Clubs 2024 sites will be open to the general public free of charge in the Paris region during the Olympic Games.
